content.description: The  route is a little left of Americorps starting on flat solid rock.  Climb carefully between the third and forth bolt.  The crux is above the forth bolt.  There is a forth class runout from the last bolt to the bolted anchor and chains.
content.protection: Bolts, the third bolt cannot be seen from the ground.

climbs.name: Peel & Core
climbs.fa: FA Karl Kiser & Noah Monagle, winter 2013

content.description: The route climbs similar to a trad climb (both sides of the bolt line).  Crux is at the last bolt a little below the anchor.  The run between the third band fourth bolt isn't as far as it appears.
content.location: Climb stars just left of Corollary.  Rap the route.

climbs.name: Parkour
climbs.fa: FA Noah Monagle & Karl Kiser, winter 2013

content.description: The crux is above the fourth bolt.  The first bolt should be unclipped once the second bolt is clipped (or stick clip the second bolt).  Clips 4, 5, 6 should be opened two foot slings to reduce rope drag (see photo).  An easy TR can be set from the top by simply reaching over the edge and attaching the rope.
content.protection: Bolts to anchors and chains at the top.
content.location: The route starts at the right side of the left cave. Rap the route.

content.description: Steep climbing for three bolts, then right and additional clips to the anchor.
content.protection: Bolts and gear.  There are welded cold shuts at the top with chain.
content.location: The right of two short routes which share a first bolt and anchor.

content.description: Boulder moves off the ground to more moves above.
content.protection: Less than optimal gear in a left to right crack.  Two bolts at the top with no chains.
content.location: The route is left of Boxy But Safe at the left side of a rock shelter.

content.description: Steep climbing for three bolts, then right and additional clips to the anchor.
content.protection: Bolts, gear and welded cold shuts at the top with chain.
content.location: The left route of two routes which share a starting bolt and fixed anchor.

content.description: Take care on the traverse from the second to the third clip.

The idea of the climb is to get to the summit of a small pinnacle via the less steep east face.  The climbing up to the crux, at the last bolt, is generally easy. The climbing is one star but the summit is definitely another star.
content.protection: Bolts to an anchor with chains.  Bring longer slings and perhaps an alpine draw for the third bolt.
content.location: The route is a bit left (south) of Boxy But Safe and right and around the corner from Cornered.  Rap the route.

content.description: The crux is above the first bolt, stemming is useful
content.protection: Bolts, continue up easier slap climbing, with two bolts, to the anchor of Softcore.  Alternately, one can go left after the fourth bolt to the Marine Corp anchor.  Thus the climb can be used to set up TRs on two additional routes.
content.location: Climb the roof to the right of Marine Corps.

content.description: Stick clip the first bolt.  Climb out  the roof of the rock shelter and establish oneself on the face.  The crux is around the first bolt although sustained climbing continues for a few feet.  Trend left to good holds between the third and fourth bolt.  Clip right for the next bolt and join Corollary for the last two bolts.
content.protection: Bolts to shared anchor with Corollary.
content.location: The route is a few feet right of Corollary.  Start in the rock shelter (the left cave) and climb out the roof.  Rap the route.
Located between Applecore and Peel and Core.  Rap the route.

content.description: Crux is at the third bolt.  Clip the fourth bolt with a two foot sling to reduce rope drag.  The climb finishes a little right of the bolt line.
content.location: The start is a few yards right of Peel and Core.  Rap the route.

content.description: Stick clip the first bolt (the crux) and continue slightly right then push left in the steep section.  Climb up using the edge to the right of the bolt line for the last three bolts.
content.protection: Bolts to an anchor and chains shared with Micor/Mycor.
content.location: Starts in the corner right of Mycor (the right cave).  Rap the route

content.description:
Climb up to the left side of a knob, stand on the knob and finish the climb. 

  More information here:   

vainokodas.com/climbing/newâ€¦
content.location: This is the last route within Box Canyon on the left side of the canyon.  The route is some yards right of the general North End area.

climbs.name: Applecore
climbs.fa: FA Karl Kiser & Noah Monagle, winter 2013

content.description: The crux is around the first bolt, perhaps an easy 5.9 move.  Traverse left to easier climbing on the bolt line.
content.protection: Bolts to anchors and chains at the top.
content.location: Uphill and right of Softcore.  Rap the route.

climbs.name: Choreography (aka Dynocore)
climbs.fa: Noah Monagle, Bryan Pletta and Karl Kiser, winter 2016

content.description: Climb easier terrain to a small roof (third bolt) and several hard boulder moves, the crux.  After the ledge, join Espirit de Corps and continue to the top.
content.protection: Bolts to the same anchor as Espirit de Corps.
content.location: The route starts on the small face to the left of Espirit de Corps.

content.description: The no pull warm up but watch your balance.  Climbing is easier to the right of the bolt line at the last bolt.
content.location: Located between Softcore and Applecore.  Rap the route.

content.description:
This is the northern portion of Box Canyon, facing east, opposite Corner Block.  TRs can be set, from the top, on these routes with a belay and either a gear or tree anchor. 

  A stick clip is useful, although not mandatory, for several of the first bolts.  Climbing at the crag can be tricky with hidden and directional holds.
